rules: Rule1: Provided that the conservation team uses an electric vehicle, the campaign achieves environmental goals.
Rule2: Either the conservation team uses an electric vehicle or the volunteer group plants trees.
Rule3: Whenever the campaign faces regulatory hurdles, it follows that the conservation team analyzes water samples.
Rule4: Under the condition that the campaign meets community resistance, if the local government has approval, then the conservation team monitors air quality.
Rule5: The campaign meets community resistance or it gains public support.
Rule6: In the event that the campaign gains public support, given that the local government has approval, the conservation team monitors air quality.
Rule7: Either the campaign expands to a new region or it does not face legal penalties.
Rule8: Provided that the campaign achieves national recognition, it receives an international award.
Rule9: Under the condition that the campaign achieves national recognition, it does not receive an international award.
Rule10: The campaign achieves national recognition or it does not expand to a new region.
Rule11: Should the volunteer group reduce carbon footprint, the campaign achieves environmental goals.
Rule12: The campaign receives a grant or it has a funding cut or, provided that the volunteer group plants trees, it reduces carbon footprint.
Rule13: If the conservation team monitors air quality, then it conducts soil testing.
Rule14: Given that the conservation team analyzes water samples, the campaign achieves environmental goals.
Rule15: Either the local government has approval or the campaign faces regulatory hurdles.
Rule16: If it is not the case that complying with regulations implies not violating environmental laws, then the campaign faces legal penalties.
Rule17: Provided that it is not the case that the conservation team conducts soil testing or the campaign achieves environmental goals, the campaign violates environmental laws.
Rule18: In the event that it is not the case that the conservation team conducts soil testing or the campaign achieves environmental goals, the campaign complies with regulations.
facts: Fact1: The campaign does not have a funding cut.
Fact2: The campaign does not receive a grant.
Fact3: The conservation team does not conduct soil testing.
